captions.text:
Hi, I am Richard and this is Sarah, and we
are going to perform the amazing colour changing

card trick with this blue backed deck of cards.
Now the idea is very simple, I am just going

to spread the cards in front of Sarah and
ask her to push any card towards the camera.

Right ok, let's see, I am going to go for
this card here.

OK, now Sarah could have selected any card
at all from the deck, but she selected the

card which is now face down on the table and
what I am going to ask her to do is show us

which card she selected.
Right, so the card that I chose was in fact

the three of diamonds.
The three of diamonds, ok, excellent choice,

that card goes back into the deck. Now I am
going to spread the cards face up on the table.

give a little click of the fingers and you'll
see that Sarah's card here has now got a blue

back. Not particularly surprising. What's
slightly more surprising is that all of the

other cards have got red backs. And that is
the amazing colour changing card trick.

Hi, I am Richard and this is Sarah, and we
are going to perform the amazing colour changing

card trick with this blue backed deck of cards.
Now the idea is very simple, I am just going

to spread the cards in front of Sarah and
ask her to push any card towards the camera.

Right ok, let's see, I am going to go for
this card here.

OK, now Sarah could have selected any card
at all from the deck, but she selected the

card which is now face down on the table and
what I am going to ask her to do is show us

which card she selected.
Right, so the card that I chose was in fact

the three of diamonds.
The three of diamonds, ok, excellent choice,

that card goes back into the deck. Now I am
going to spread the cards face up on the table.

give a little click of the fingers and you'll
see that Sarah's card here has now got a blue

back. Not particularly surprising. What's
slightly more surprising is that all of the

other cards have got red backs. And that is
the amazing colour changing card trick.

comments.author: BlueInfinity22

comments.text:
It's called "Memory Bias" the brain doesn't like to admit it doesn't 
understand something, so it lies. It rewrites memories to make it seem like 
it was always that way, it destroys your perception of reality to makes 
sense out of the impossible, and other times it will just erase the memory. 
It happens when you try to remember something you have forgotten as well, 
you will end up remembering it differently than what really happened or 
just "remember" something that never happened. Rather than simply admit it 
doesn't know it creates a fabrication of reality for you.
comments.author: Fist-of-doom

comments.author: Jaron White

comments.text:
It's called "Memory Bias" all of it happened right in front of your eyes 
and you should have memorized it as soon as it registered in your head. But 
your brain doesn't like admitting it doesn't know, so it lies. It tricks 
itself into believing nothing changed. It will rewrite your memories to 
make it seem like it was always that way, destroy your own perception of 
reality to make sense out something impossible, or outright erase it.

comments.author: Gnarley Ric

comments.text:
Well to start, I don't think he intended for this to even be considered a 
magic trick. It's more along the lines of a "mind fuck" He wants us to view 
the bigger picture, test our skills on what we notice and what we don't pay 
any attention to at all....teach us a lesson maybe even? Regardless I don't 
think this was pointless, it entertained me! I enjoyed this video very 
much, I've seen it tons of times after it's release and I was fooled the 
first time.
